result.adr_address: 173 Bd Lefebvre, 75015 Paris, France

reviews.text: We came across this brasserie by pure chance on our way home and we couldn't resist the urge to sit down and taste a vegetable juice for me (celery, cucumber, carrots, lime, mint) and a fruit juice ( orange, grapefruit, pineapple mint) for Madame. All freshly squeezed in front of us. Latin atmosphere, like a holiday air, it feels good! A big thank you for your welcome, we will be back very soon to taste your sardines and all the other dishes that we have seen.
What a great idea to offer Mediterranean-style sardines on Saturday for lunch, with a glass of white wine, that's perfect. Warm welcome and fast service in this neighborhood brasserie.

A very friendly place.
The owner is super nice.
And the prices are very decent.
I highly recommend ü§ó

At Samir we are always well received, very caring, his collaborators are at the top, in his image üòÄüëå.

The sardines are excellent, you can go there with your children, it's very friendly and it's downright financially accessible.

Thank you for giving life to this neighborhood, I wish you courage in this difficult time.

The Barrys
Super Spot to eat a good dish and make a little foam ... I highly recommend ...

result.adr_address: 2 Rue des Morillons, 75015 Paris, France
result.name: Aux Sports

reviews.text: My family and I are big football (f√∫tbol/soccer) fans and we were looking for a comfortable place to watch a few games from different leagues while in Paris. We were well received, were able to watch a game from the Premier League AND La Liga, and had great beer while doing so. It was late so the kitchen was closed but nevertheless a great time. The man who accommodated us was friendly, welcoming, and fun. Would totally recommend to sports fans.

The owner is nice, great atmosphere for watching football matches, I went there to watch champions league semifinal match, it was full and everyone was nice and polite even when it was full and crowded the owner took care of everyone.
You can have lunch or dinner while watching.
Not so expensive and not cheap, I recommend it.
Extremely bad service and horrible food. Not sure why they advertise as a sports bar, should be trash bar
Great local dive. Very authentic. The owner supports Rennes FC and Sporting Lisbon. Good stuff
Small, quaint place. Lovely owner and bar staff. Good place to watch football

result.adr_address: 24 Rue de Vouill√©, 75015 Paris, France

reviews.text: Very friendly staff and good experience. We enjoyed a lunch outside. Meat was not cooked the way we had ordered, but the food was ok. The house ros√© wine was really bad though. First time that happened in a brasserie in Paris.
Really nice place with lovely staff. We had lunch there and paid 15 Euros for the menu (starter + main dish + drink). Was a nice experience and we can recommend a visit there :)
A fantastic bar, the locals were very friendly we had a great time dancing, drinking & meeting new friends. The bar staff were amazing too, highly recommend a visit, we will be back!! thank you!!
Breakfast coffee and simple meals at a local restaurant are excellent for the price

Everything is right here üçÄ

A piece of lively Paris on the corner, with delicious espresso (also decaf if necessary), great food, the preparation of which is gladly discussed at the table along with the news of the last few days. The team is careful, courteous and hospitable with a sense of humour. It's a pleasure to be there and to eat.. by the way, if there's still room for dessert, the caramel tiramis√∫ is an insider tip. That's what they're "famous" for in the neighborhood!

reviews.text: I came here during a bar crawl, it was the last stop for the night and oh am I glad it was! Music was great from the time we walked in until the time we left. The drinks were amazing! The staff was so nice! There was indoor and outdoor seating and bars, this place went on and on.  Its very laid back in some spots so if you don't want to be in the big crowd but listen to the music, there are sections in here to enjoy the atmosphere. This place is so much fun!!

Really liked the atmosphere here. You can enjoy an Australian beer while watching a live sport. Multiple bathrooms. Great location. Prices are moderate (for Paris)! Staff is nice. üëçüèºüç∫üá¶üá∫

Tip: fries with cheddar cheese and fried onion was so delicious!

Looks like a good watering hole for when you‚Äôre in Montparnasse, the staff tend to amuse themselves when it‚Äôs slow but when there‚Äôs work to be done their on the ball. Food was good and reasonably priced as with the beers. Music was not too loud for a afternoon session. Most importantly it‚Äôs air-conditioned and comfortable as it is 38¬∞ outside.
The place is great for drinking beer and attending football matches, worth a visit and enjoying the atmosphere

Very nice place extremely enjoyable.
The security did stop me and when I explain that I‚Äôm tourist he was very interested and thank me for choosing this facility.

result.adr_address: 10 Rue Vandamme, 75014 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Breton craft beers & sharing plates at a snug modern bar with a blackboard menu & street tables.

result.name: Ker Beer - Bar √† bi√®res

reviews.text:
Good craft beer selection. Even open on Sundays. I suggest to order the Good Vibes American Pale Ale. Price range average ‚Ç¨5 for a demi and  about ‚Ç¨9 for a pint.

Only downside for me is the toilet. Giving 2 stars for the ambiance as the bathroom reeked of urine. Men's urinal is next to the women's toilet. You can smell the strong pungent odor even from the inside.

Doors info: open 7/7 from 17 to 02.
Google maps: till 1:30.
Reality 23:44 - closed!
I was going 30 minutes here... Like really? It is so hard to be honest? Please, change your open hours info or make it truly opened. üëé

Edit: Finally barman showed, he was really nice, sell me a beer to go and recommend me another bar. Changed from 1 star to 2. But still, change the opend hours.

Answer to reaction of the owner: You could have forgiven the sarcastic remark about people sleeping in Paris. My review referred to misleading information about opening hours. Above all, you should think about your staff who have to clean and possibly change and adjust that time. I don't know what the information is that you are open until 02:00 if it is not true, or only if someone is there.
One of the best craft beer bars in Paris. Fantastic Ciders also!
Amazingly friendly place. Very knowledgeable about the Paris craft beer scene and recommended La Fine Louse, which I enjoyed on a later trip.

Great craft beer in a friendly and low key pub. Lots on tap and more in bottles/cans. Friendly people and excellent vibes. All the beer is made with grain from Brittany (and there must have been hundreds), cool concept. It's even a cooperative. Located very convenient to Montparnasse train station.

reviews.text: Love the ambiance of this Lesbian bar. Mary was very nice. It really felt like a community in the bar. She had a lot of regulars coming in. People knew each other. The business opened 2 years ago so it was nice to see more gay bars for women in Paris.

Located in Marais neighborhood it is a great local lesbian bar. Owner is a lovely lady that tried to her best to make me and my girlfriend feel welcome there. It is a smaller bar but with a great soul. Recommend it!

result.adr_address: 15 Pl. Vend√¥me, 75001 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Genteel haunt of the American writer, with leather armchairs, sepia photos & a honed cocktail menu.

result.name: Bar Hemingway

reviews.text: Our favorite place we went to in Paris! One of my favorite parts of the experience was the menu. It's a newspaper-style menu with a description/history of each drink option. We were supposed to stay for an hour and ended up staying for four! Expect a line to get into the bar or plan to get there right when they open. The service was top notch, the ambiance can't be beat, and the snacks were perfect to nibble on. I dream of going back here and this is my top recommendation for anyone who visits Paris!

I love Place Vend√¥me but If happen to rain Hemingway Bar is the best place to be. Is small and sophisticated Bar with amazing cocktails and a touch of history. Next door you must try The Comptoir we call it the temple of pastry :)

It is the place where I return again and again and every time I am surprised by the staff and the delicious cocktails. You are wonderful!!!
The cocktail with many fruits that I drank in February was delicious and I hope it will be back on the menu!!! Plssssssss ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Drinks definitely had alcohol in them....a little too strong personally.

Lovely place for sure. After all the claims about this place having the best martinis, we patiently waited in line before getting seated. (You might have to wait from 20-40 mins before you get a spot.)

We ordered the Martini and it was very strong, it wasn't bad but I believe they've hyped it excessively.

Stick to the Ritz Bar, vibe and drinks are better.

result.adr_address: 14 Rue Claude Tillier, 75012 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Colorful, fruit-centric cocktails served in a zen-inspired bar with Buddha statues & plush seating.

result.name: Inside bar paris

reviews.text:
One of my favourite places in Paris! Such a happy atmosphere! Best cocktails! Happiest happy hours!

Update 2022: still my favourite cocktail bar. Cool music. Nice barman üëå

Very warm people and amazing cocktails.
We go regularly there since the price is affordable and the quality is great.
I recommend this bar
Really nice place cocktails are great the service and the mojitos we had the planche for 2 people good size

Cocktail lovers, you can call off the search. Tucked away in a quiet street between Bastille and Nation lies Inside Bar, a down-to-earth establishment that serves some of the best cocktails you‚Äôll find in Paris. Enter and you will notice that the vibe veers towards Zen, with a plethora of Buddha statues decorating the bar, and club lounge music playing gently in the background. Faux black leather, chandeliers and red velvet complete the ensemble for a splash of faded glamour.
But the real draw of Inside Bar is its excellent cocktails. Choose from the old favorites advertised above the bar, or opt for a made-to-measure tipple and prepare to be mesmerized by the stunning presentation, more reminiscent of a swish Champs-Elys√©es address than a discreet bar in eastern Paris.
Drinks are served in the correct glasses and swathed in berries and elaborately carved fruits. In the unlikely event that you‚Äôre unhappy, the barmen will tinker with your cocktail until you‚Äôre completely satisfied. Relatively new on the scene, this bar is a well-kept secret, with that rare thing: truly personalized service. It tends to be quiet during the week before getting busier at weekends. So choose your time wisely according to whether you‚Äôre looking for chilled-out drinks with friends or a warm-up for a big night out.
Very intimate spot. Amazing cocktails made with love and care. Highly recommend!!!

reviews.text: A quiet little cafe with perfect buttery croissant and cup of coffee to start the day is going to lift your mood.

I like the homemade vibe of the place, but I think the food handling could be improved.
However, I'd recommend it if you want to hear lots of local people.
Authentic French caf√© with a vintage decor. One of the last in the district, believe me. If you're looking for authenticity and sympathy, you won't regret it

result.adr_address: 299 Rue Lecourbe, 75015 Paris, France
result.name: Bar Heure Sup'

reviews.text: Very nice SPORT bar where you can spend good time watching sports events, have a drink with friends, chats with a barmen, play darts, discuss with people, have fun. In Paris it is really difficult to find a real sport bar with a good looking atmosphere and pleasant services.

Put some Doritos on a plate and call it "Mexican Tapas". Put some tuna paste on small baguette slices and call it "Mediterranean Toast" (see picture). If not clear, avoid the food. At least you can watch football matches and play darts.

I've been going to Heure Sup' for a while now, well, since Fulham were still in Premier League (as I'm writing this, the club is in its third season in the Championship). I find this bar to be great place, both to watch sports and to have a drink. The owners are extremely friendly and welcoming. The drink selection is extensive and the food is what I consider to be 'bar food' more than a proper meal.
The opening hours are very extensive - up to 2am at the weekend - and the owner are more than willing to show any sports if contacted in advance on Facebook. Can get busy when PSG are playing.
I most definitely recommend this place.
H.

I really recommend this bar if you want to watch a game or just drink with friends in a nice and friendly place.
The barman is very nice and makes you feel like home.

result.name: Little Temple Bar

reviews.text: An Dublin-like oasis in the heart of the Parisian Left Bank üáÆüá™üçª ... After all the French wine has exhausted you; an Irish Red Ale or Stout (or even a French wheat beer) will reinvigorate you ü•≥

I was visiting Paris and walking around  and I passed this bar at night. I walked in and had the most amazing night. I stayed till closing and everybody was extremely nice. The staff was great and so was the atmosphere. I did not try any food, but the drinks were splendid. I definitely recommend checking out this place.

Nice bar with a good range of beers. Seems like quite a vibrant pub if you are just looking to relax in a place that has nice vibes. Staff were very friendly and tried to find the game I wanted to watch on their channels
Is a little bit pricey but that is to be expected in Paris

This pub is racist and filled with bigotry. My friends and I turned up without having a drink all day but were ‚Äútoo drunk‚Äù and we were wearing kilts from Scotland. Local french people that could not walk in a straight line were let in without question. Disgusting behaviour.
Lovely Irish pub! Furniture and dec is very Irish like. Hugo is a gent, would highly recommend!

Cozy, classy, elegant and still very laid back. Plenty of comfy seats for two. Nice selection of cocktails and Bartender, Alec, can do any others.

Great vibes and even better drinks!

Great to recommend
Just fine, friendly staff

result.adr_address: 228 Rue de Rivoli, 75001 Paris, France
result.name: Bar 228

reviews.text: We popped by Bar 228 walking home from dinner at the suggestion of a local guide. Shout out to the staff at Le Maurice! Everyone we encountered was so nice. The bar and cocktails, albeit pricey, were incredible. We were fortunate to visit while live music was being played, that with the moody decor made for the perfect ambiance.

Compared to other palaces this one offered us most probably the best experience. The cocktails are incredible, the ancient chic Parisian atmosphere can be felt everywhere. Having live music makes it all the more enjoyable. Cherry on the cake, the staff is incredibly nice. Will make sure to come back soon.
Intimate, old-world charm ambiance, outstanding service and the most divine sauternes I had while in Paris.

Elegant and sophisticated bar with prices to match. They very kindly split a salad for us, and we then felt happier to splurge on wine. Lovely selection- try the croze hermitage. Waitstaff very polite and friendly, too. Not your typical Parisian bar. Feels more like New York replete with smiling people and high ceilings.
Exquisite bar, romantic setting, excellent service. The pianist and the saxophonist‚Äôs performance truly enhanced the whole experience.

result.adr_address: 251 Rue Saint-Honor√©, 75001 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Chic, luxurious hotel venue with a marble bar & walls inlaid with crystals, for creative cocktails.

result.name: Bar 8

reviews.text: In love with this place came two Saturday‚Äôs in a row with my friend, the best service we have had in Paris by far. So sweet and welcoming, the staff is amazing and the atmosphere as well. Very beautiful place and the cocktails are delicious and the food as well. 100/10 recommend.

One of the highlights of our Paris trip was drinks at this beautiful bar. The hostess Marina is the sweetest person ever. She went above and beyond to seat us outside. She kept coming back and checking on us making sure we got drinks. Her attention made our experience amazing. The drinks were delicious and our waiter was very friendly too. Highly recommend this place.

What a fantastic place to be in the heart of Paris. Stunning service and excellent menu/carte. Prices are more than fair for the 5* bar location, Top-notch service always with the smile starting from host till drinks servings. Ambiance¬†is¬†splendid
Fantastic! Anastasia is the perfect host, Daniel and Thomas make the best drinks (order the paper plane)! Ambiance is supurb.

We stopped by for a quick bite on the way out of the hotel but were hugely disappointed by the service. Took over 30 minutes to bring our light bites out. The overpriced croque monsieur was good but the Asian bowl turned out to be a bland poke bowl (and they forgot the salmon which we had ordered with it). Pretty ambience but don‚Äôt go there unless you have plenty of time to kill.

result.adr_address: 82 Rue de Charenton, 75012 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Sharing platters & a long cocktail menu at a cozy stop with bar staff in boxer shorts & bow ties.

result.name: Le Calbar

reviews.text: Amazing cocktail bar! One of the highlights of our trip to Paris. The drinks were delicious and the service was fantastic. They constantly provided us with complimentary water and also made great non-alcoholic cocktails for our party member who does not drink. The bar was cozy and comfortable with a laid back attitude where the employees wear Boxer shorts and bowties. Overall we enjoyed our visit and would like to come again on our next trip to Paris.

Cozy and lovely little cocktail bar where the bartender serve you in underpants. Nice atmosphere. Cocktails rather expensive but very delicious.
Definitely worth checking out. It seems to be one of the few bars in the area serving drinks on a Friday night until 2am.

Best cocktail bar I've ever been to. Ordered a cocktail from the menu as well as 2 Surprise Me cocktails and all 3 were delicious. Incredibly talented bartenders put on a show and can make you anything you might think of. Just give them a couple words for what you're looking for and they're able to put something together from the top of their heads, very impressive.

Highly recommend this bar, can't wait to go back!
Calbar was one of the most amazing and unique experiences we had in Paris. Super fun drinks and atmosphere, incredible service.

Amazing cocktails! We love coming here and getting the ‚Äúsurprise‚Äù cocktail. You basically just tell the bartenders what flavors and alcohol you like (smokey, sweet, etc.) and they take it from there! (Beware they‚Äôre deceptively strong!) The atmosphere is always friendly and the bartenders make it a fun experience. Have not tried the food although they do have some small plates.

result.adr_address: 60 Rue Jean-Jacques Rousseau, 75001 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Bar bites & unique cocktails in a laid-back, intimate gathering place with ornate gold accents.

result.name: Isadora Cocktail Bar

reviews.text: Amazing bar tender who makes the best cocktails, and is a great entertainer. Everyone is friendly here and the cocktails are superb to say the least. Definitely worth a visit when you are in Paris. I came here the last two nights of my trip because it‚Äôs just that good.

We came here because the reviews on google were great and it did not disappoint!  Sweet friendly service by all the bartenders. The drinks were all really creative. The vibe of the bar was just right!  Would coke back to this place as a tourist or a local.

We only went for drinks, so I can't rate the food. It did look awesome though, based on what others were served.
Now about the drinks: I've been to many cocktail bars before and this one really stands out. Tons of home-made ingredients blended to perfection! And all that at about 12 to 15 Euros per Drink. Add friendly, bilingual (french &, Englisch) staff on top of that and you've got a place Worth visiting.
Delicious cocktails with recipes changing every 6 months. The homemade tapenade was amazing. Service was delightful

One of the best cocktail bars I have ever tried. Victoria has a real talent for creating innovative and well balanced cocktails. Great music, pleasant atmosphere and very friendly staff. Totally recommend!

result.adr_address: 5 Rue Daunou, 75002 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Classic, bespoke & Cuban-style cocktails in a chic, wood-lined space with a piano bar in the cellar.

result.name: Harry's New York Bar

reviews.text:
I would definitely give it more than 5 stars if it had.  The feeling is indescribable when you enter this beautiful bar. The feeling as if you entered a bar a hundred years ago. Excellent decorations, excellent quality of drinks, excellent staff attitude.
Definitely, if someone asks me for the address of a good bar in Paris, this is the first place. If I come to Paris again, I will definitely visit here.
It is recommended

This bar is awesome! Especially if you are a fan of Hemingway and the Lost Generation, this is one of his old haunts and a haven for expats in Paris. You always get to see and meet new people from around the world and the vibe is so on point for imagining you're there with the Lost Generation having philosophical discussions and pontificating about the world. Yes the drinks are a bit expensive, (you are in Paris after all, and across from the opera) but it is a famous bar with major historical and literary significance so definitely worth it. This bar is also known for having created many cocktails including the French 75 (by some regarded as the first cocktail), the Bloody Mary, and the Sidecar.

I stopped in here on my birthday to have a Bloody Mary so I could say that I‚Äôd done it, but it was such a convivial atmosphere that I stayed for more. Strangers wished me a bonne anniversaire, I had a great chat with the barman about immersing yourself in foreign languages, and - most importantly - the drinks were superb.

Harry‚Äôs bar
Claim‚Äôs to be Europe‚Äôs oldest bar and inventor of the Bloody Mary, this place is a must if you want to make a pilgrimage to drink this holy beverage that has saved me on many occasions the following morning after a big night out. we stopped to take a break after a lot of walking and they have a restroom.

Seating
Inside seating is comfy, intimate with high dealings and small tables. Can sit groups of 2 or 4.

Food
I ordered two tasty hotdogs served with a side of tomato sauce, mustard and pickle relish. That‚Äôs the only food they offer on the menu and it hit the spot, we came to drink and appreciated the hotdogs as a snack.

Drinks
The Bloody Mary is a must if you are a fan and I ordered one and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. Experienced mixologists on hand brought me the Trinidad sour was was great although without the egg foam as they are usually made in Australia nevertheless it was good and interesting to drink it without it. The cocktails on the menu have some interesting flavour combinations I‚Äôve never seen together before.

10/10 I will come back and drink the cocktails all over again.

Exquisite Prohibition-Era cocktail bar and the oldest cocktail bar in Europe! This beautiful bar is the original Harry's New York Bar, shipped to Paris by Henry, when the Prohibition Era began in the US. Every bespoke cocktail is a work of art! The bartenders are incredible!

result.adr_address: 88 Rue Didot, 75014 Paris, France
result.name: Le Beau Bar

reviews.text:
Stopped in here on a whim and it was worth it. We were asked questions about our wine preferences and then given three tastings to choose from. Everyone seemed local and happy to be there. Each table gets a bowl of popcorn and the best part is the price, ¬£7 per glass.

Can you wear shorts here? Oui, this place isn't stuffy or pretentious at all.

The staff at le beau bar were wonderful - they accommodated our large group (that arrived annoyingly early) with a smile and kept us laughing and drinking all evening - we stayed far longer than we planned because we were having such a nice time. We can‚Äôt wait to come back for cocktails!

This cosy bar in the 14th neighborhood of Paris is one of the most friendly places on the whole earth, well, at least among those I ever visited, and believe me I visited a lot of bars. If you are a person new to Paris, this is a place to go because the owners, Camill, Jeniffer, and Endy (not sure if I got their names correctly here), are very friendly and you can easily start conversation to other customers and get hints about life in Paris. If you don't know any French, they can speak english very well. If you know little French, it's a good place to practice your speaking skills.

If you already live in Paris, you can visit this place with your girlfriend, wife, and other friends, speak for hours over some beers and wines.

Their drinks are casual drinks and the place offers a good selection of food that you can share with your party of friends.

It's also a good rendezvous location. Frankly, I don't know many places like this in where I live in the US or other places I lived before in the past 20 years.

This place saves me from boredom when I was stating if Paris alone for a couple of weeks of a business trip. My colleagues had family and were to busy to hang out.

Finally, if you ever stayed in Paris, visit Le Beau Bar and experience French hospitality and friendliness, especially if you were unlucky and experienced some hostility before.
Lovely place, nice drinks and friendly staff! We recommend this place if you stay nearby. Too bad it was only open untill 2 a.m.!
I love this place.  Wonderful people in the heart of Paris.  My Go-to!

reviews.text:
A great place to catch up with friends for fun and memorable times.
The food is awesome and so are the beer and the service. Pierre and Monika are the best bar owners, feels like family. Great decoration and pinball machine too.
Nice neighborhood or visitor bar. Feels like a your local neighborhood bar with a great clientele stopping by to feed their families or catch a rugby match.
We had 3 really wonderful evenings in this pub. The staff is great and always open for a chat.
Pretty cool ‚Äòdive bar‚Äô. Nice atmosphere and they have food! I only speak English and Spanish and know 0 French and was able to manage to hang out. Cool bartender guy.

National Rugby match, very good person and nice whisky. Awesome night.
Thank you guys!

result.adr_address: 100 Rue Cambronne, 75015 Paris, France
result.name: Le Bar de M

reviews.text: An original, intimate bar in an incredible setting. Difficult to locate but definitely worth a visit. The manager prepares high quality cocktails for you even during happy hour. Be careful, however, after a certain hour‚Ä¶ appearances are deceptive!

An atypical place‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ a little corner of paradise‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ we were very well received and loved the quirky atmosphere and the open-mindedness of the boss.

I only put 4 stars because I vomited a good part of the night but everything else was great!
I recommend

Very atypical bar, superb discovery. The boss, when he's not too busy drinking after 2 p.m., will be keen to offer you plenty of drinks if he realizes that you're going downhill fast. Be careful not to criticize his gin + red wine mix, the guy is touchy and won't hesitate to threaten you with a broken bottle if you don't give up your 5 stars on Google.

A real atypical place, hidden in a Parisian building, which doesn't look like much at first glance and I mean at first glance. Because once inside, it's a change of scenery. A lively atmosphere, a mix between a garage sale and a brothel. To be tested for all fans of "underground" bars.
The manager is friendly but becomes virulent after a few drinks. A word of advice, don't offer him negrita. Too bad for the 5 stars..

A bar like I have rarely seen, I will return!
Thank you again for the welcome and for your kindness!
Go there with your eyes closed

reviews.text: Great place for different wine tasting! Especially nice red wines !

while I and my student (Emir Taha) was reading a text about this restaurant, we saw it and googled it on the browser. Now we are observing the restaurant and we really liked the shape of it. Enjoy your your meal to everyone and good luck to all employees. Greetings

Very cool place. Went there for a bday party and it was so much fun. My friend could book the terrace which is small but very cozy. The bar is also very neat and the deco is cool. Service was nice and all went alright.

The only negative thing might have been the happy hour ending so early and the beer price right after. Like 7 or 8 Euros for a paint.

Had a very good time there, and the ovner is very frendly. Good selections off drinks, and vines, and more.
A must go to in Paris.

A good atmosphere on a Friday night, people there for drinks as well as to eat. Food was good but not exceptional, perhaps worth trying the sharing platters rather than the standard a la carte menu. The staff were very friendly and the cocktails looked great.

reviews.text:
Undoubtedly the ugliest and most poorly maintained caf√© in Paris! Very dirty, absent service, it does not make you want to enter.
The boss remains seated at a table instead of taking care of it.
A wart in the street that would do well to get up to date.

Former bar transformed into a relay point. Parcel lost, then found, but the manager no longer has a phone in the meantime. Unable to reach the relay point. I will have to go there 5 times (opening hours never respected) to be able to collect my package, it took me 15 days. Mondial relay and this relay point I strongly advise against!
Simple old fashioned PMU bar.
It launders money around here... I know everything...

We visited this bar one evening as we were staying at a hotel just 100 yards away.
we were greeted by friendly hosts who went out of their way to both make us feel comfortable and also to include us in their circle. we finished up dancing with the staff and customers.
We can unconditionally recommend this bar to everyone. A great night, friendly people and lots of fun.
we will make a point of going there again on our next visit to Paris.

reviews.text:
Lovely place! We walked by and went in not knowing what to expect. The place is very small and cosy so we started talking to the other customers. Valerie the waitress was wonderful and made us very good drinks. This is a night bar, open from 8pm to 5am. Definitely a ‚Äúbar d‚Äôhabitu√©s‚Äù where you get a ‚Äúat home vibe‚Äù and where people know each other.
We went back the following day and spent new year‚Äôs eve there with wonderful people. We will definitely visit again! Great find! Merci les filles!

So and so.
Noisy and very drunk people are somehow destroying the beauty and unique quality of this Bar.

Not really sure what to think about this place.
From outside it looks like any bar.
Where. Stepping I you wonder where you are.  Looks like a hookup bar where the seats are not really new, the tables are not really clean.   The bar man is from another time.
The choice of alcohols is ok yet a little limited.
Then you Google the place and you discover it was F. Scott Fitzgerald's favorite bar... Hence the name of the place..
So it is not that bad after all.
I would nonetheless recommended a good modernization of the place.
The price is fair.
Nar was empty, not a bad place for some American drinks.
Top

reviews.text: The perfect place for your happy hour. Amazing beers, tasty tapas and perfect management. You need to go here for your aperitif and happy hour

Last night of our trip to Paris and visited during happy hour which is 15:00h til midnight. Amazing service - the happy hour drinks menu was talked through with us and the drinks were refeshing in 36¬∞c heat. Barman was a real gent üëå. Thank you!

The people are great, the vibe of the place is very nice, the prices are cheap (great for students). The only problem was that when I ordered fries I could taste shrimps. They probably used the same oil for shrimp as fries. That was not pleasant. Everything else was great
This place sells 300ml beers as 50cl.  I ordered 2 25cl.  Second round they made them smaller.  These guys are horribly dishonest

Great selection and setup to enjoy a drink in Paris. My friends and I really enjoyed our time here and the owner, Pierre, was very welcoming and provided excellent service!

Great addition to the 15th. Owner is friendly and knowledgeable. Well curated selection of craft beer and expansive selection of natural wines. Nice small plates. Love the decor and mellow atmosphere. Highly recommended.
Great place! Really good craft beers from small brewery in paris. Good & generous sharing plates as well with a south west of France taste

result.adr_address: 61 Quai de Grenelle, 75015 Paris, France
result.name: Bar QGrenelle

reviews.text: Bartender hated us from the moment we stepped in. We waited by the door, inside the restaurant, and he didn't acknowledge us. After a good 3-4 minutes, we thought we had to seat ourselves and walked in a little further to see if there were seats around the corner we could take as it was quite empty. Bartender roughly told us to wait a moment so we did. He sat us at a dairy table, we had to clean it ourselves (seats and all). No one came to take our order for over 10 minutes, so a member from our group went to the bar to ask if we could order some coffee. He came over, took an order for 4 and brought only 3 coffees and 3 waters. I understand if you forget the coffee but why would you think it's appropriate to only being 3 waters when there are 4 at the table. It's just mean... Anyway. Very disappointed and we just came for coffee...

Great service & Drinks! Pascal & Jose served us the best drinks! They went above and beyond and truly understand the bar & the drinks that they serve! We appreciate getting to know these bartenders, as they treated us like royalty every time we were there!

-Noah :)

Exceptionally poor service. Completely in attentive. I had to remind them of my beer order.  They brought the wrong beer in the wrong volume but I was happy to have something so took it.  Asked for katsup for my fries,  it never came.  Finished my meal, no one came to ask if I wanted anything else and I had to chase them down to get the check.  Really wanted to just walk out but I'm not a thief.  Not too busy just really, really bad staff. I'm in the hotel for several nights and wouldn't go back for anything.
Pizzas good and fast. Less than 5 minutes. Parisians Brune is a great beer.
Attached to the Novotel.  Drinks are pricey service is average

reviews.text: We had a great time on the patio. The boss is very friendly and helpful. We took cocktail, wine and cheese board for 2 people (about 21‚Ç¨ in total). Good value for money with a fairly late happy hour in addition.
On the terrace, pleasant boss but the basic glass of wine is 8eur. The "tartines" are a simple slice of bread with grated cheese and a slice of industrial cheddar cheese, disappointing.
Owners very nice and incredibly kind. Amazing and tasty cocktails! Warm, festive and friendly atmosphere. Very nice decor. Evening at the top. Recommended address!

Super nice boss, warm atmosphere, good music. We can chat without having to shout while having a festive musical background, great service, colorful decor, choice of beers and cocktails, boards etc. I highly recommend !

Beautiful and cozy place. The attention is excellent! We understood each other perfectly.
Rich food and the wine is ten.
It is to recommend.

result.vicinity: 18 Rue du Pot de Fer, Paris

result.adr_address: 16 Rue du Pot de Fer, 75005 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Small, laid-back tavern with Belgian beers on tap & outdoor seating in a bustling alley.

result.formatted_address: 16 Rue du Pot de Fer, 75005 Paris, France
result.name: Le Chouff'Bar

reviews.text: Great beer, clean glasses, awesome bartender

Go for the beer not the atmosphere.
Great price for a good pint of Chouff. However, the spot would greatly need a refresh. There are other options along the streets if the atmospehere is key.
Plus: clean glasses seem to be optional there.

A gem of wonderful Belgium beers and warm hospitality. Outside seating on a picturesque Parisian alley coupled with wonderful service from the charismatic manager Byron makes Le Chouff one of my favorite places. Whenever I‚Äôm in Paris I make it a point to see Byron and socialize at Le Chouff‚Äô bar.
Friendly bartender, cold beer. What else do you need in a good bar?
Nice pub. They have really good beers.

editorial_summary.overview: Wine is served with charcuterie & cheese boards in this quaint bar with live music & a cozy vibe.

result.formatted_address: rue, 7 Rue du Pot de Fer, 75005 Paris, France
result.name: Le Bar de Fer

reviews.text: Very nice bar with live music! Friendly staff, good food, tasty beer and cocktails !

You like wine? You enjoy live music? You prefer better quality food to fast food? Well, this is the place for you! An amazing bar to spend an evening with a friend.
You have places inside and outside (heated if the weather is cold).
I did not find a menu online before the visit, so, hopefully my pictures of the menu will be added.
Meat or fish based and vegetarian dishes.
Good choice of wines.
Generous portions.
Friendly staff.
Delicious food, amazing wine, good live music and really nice staff that talked to us in English and helped with wine selection. We really enjoy this place and highly recommend!
Cozy nice bar √† vin! The waitress was super welcoming!

A great local bar with great food and super kind staff. There is live music every night after 21:00 except Sunday nights(Open mic). I‚Äôd say Charcuterie is the best that I‚Äôve ever had in France following by Spaghetti Bolognese.

editorial_summary.overview: Cocktails, beers & charcuterie plates in a cozy, quirky bar with a leopardskin wall & teddy bears.

result.name: Teddy's Bar

reviews.text:
Quaint, clean and simple settings are what you are in for if you decide to stop for a drink (or two) there. Snacking options are offered to complement your drinks. Decent selection of drafter beers.
Indoor and outdoor seating options. Board and card games at your disposal.

WOW
Beautiful location.
Kind and precise barman.
Very good beer for 6‚Ç¨ after 8pm (3.90‚Ç¨ for what I can remember, before 8pm). Ted (cocktail with tequila, mango etc...) absolutely delicious for just 8.5‚Ç¨.
Gems: bear peluches inside the bar, board games, playing cards and dices
Great decoration, great service and reasonable prices. Some cocktails seem to be too sweet so maybe instead of having so many cocktails focus on the good ones
Cool and nice bar with a huge list of cocktails

A great bar with a local pub attatude. Good beer on tap - wide range of cocktails and very friendly staff. The vibe was relaxed but animated on the Thursday night we popped in. While we didn't eat the mixed boards looked great for a substantial bar snack to share. If you fancy a pint or glass of wine this is a great place to visit.
